abstract.p: McCann-Erickson World Group in New York acquires Waylon Company in St. Louis; Colle & McVoy in Minneapolis acquires Mackenzie Marketing in Minneapolis; Corsi Agency in San Francisco acquires Chapman Warwick in San Diego; Red in Mill Valley, Calif, merges with Heater Advertising in Boston; Golin/Harris International in Chicago acquires Creative Event Marketing in Atlanta (M)

block.p: Several agencies are making deals for undisclosed terms.

The McCann-Erickson World Group in New York, part of the Interpublic Group of Companies, acquired the Waylon Company in St. Louis, which offers sales promotion services, and merged it with Momentum Worldwide in New York, a McCann-Erickson World Group company that specializes in event marketing and sales promotion. The combined unit, Momentum Worldwide, has billings estimated at $860 million from clients like Coca-Cola.
Several agencies are making deals for undisclosed terms.

The McCann-Erickson World Group in New York, part of the Interpublic Group of Companies, acquired the Waylon Company in St. Louis, which offers sales promotion services, and merged it with Momentum Worldwide in New York, a McCann-Erickson World Group company that specializes in event marketing and sales promotion. The combined unit, Momentum Worldwide, has billings estimated at $860 million from clients like Coca-Cola.

Colle & McVoy in Minneapolis, majority owned by the Maxxcom unit of the MDC Corporation, acquired Mackenzie Marketing in Minneapolis, which specializes in strategic marketing. Mackenzie, which has 35 employees and revenue estimated at $8.5 million from clients like American Express, will become a unit of Colle & McVoy. Andrew Mackenzie, 36, president, and Julie Mackenzie, 42, chief operating officer, will continue in those posts.
The Corsi Agency in San Francisco acquired Chapman Warwick in San Diego, an agency with 15 employees and billings estimated at $10 million to $12 million from clients like the Walt Disney Company.

Chapman Warwick had been majority owned by Warwick Baker O'Neill in New York, part of EPB Communications, and minority owned by its president, Nancy Higgins. Chapman Warwick will be renamed Corsi Chapman Warwick and operate as a unit of Corsi. Ms. Higgins, 53, will be president.

Red in Mill Valley, Calif., merged with Heater Advertising in Boston to form an agency with 33 employees and billings estimated at $35 million from clients like Anheuser-Busch and WebTV. Heater will be renamed Red, and function as the agency's Boston office.

Golin/Harris International in Chicago, part of the Interpublic Group of Companies, acquired Creative Event Marketing in Atlanta, a corporate event production agency. Creative Event, to be renamed CrossMediaCEM, will operate as a unit of a Golin/Harris subsidiary, CrossMedia Golin/Harris.
